a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Human Development Index vs. mean male height, 1996
The Human Development Index (HDI) is a summary measure of key dimensions of human development:
a long and healthy life, being knowledgeable and having a decent standard of living. It's measured from 0
to 1 (where higher is better). This is shown against mean male height in adults by year of birth.
Mean male height by year of birth
Data source: UNDP, Human Development Report (2021-22), NCD RisC, Human Height (2017)
